NetCoupler 0.0.4.9000

Estimating pathways to an estimated DAG from an exposure.

Source: R/exposure-estimates.R
nc_exposure_estimates.Rd

This algorithm estimates direct effects of a predefined exposure on each network-variable for all causal models that agree with the input-network: models are adjusted for all possible combinations of direct neighbors (==variables in the adjacency set) -> Output is a multiset of possible effects

nc_exposure_estimates(
  .data,
  .graph,
  .exposure,
  .adjustment_vars,
  .model_function,
  .exponentiate = FALSE,
  ...
)

Arguments

.data

A data.frame that contains the data with the metabolic variables and the outcome.
.graph

The estimated graph skeleton obtained from nc_create_network().
.exposure

Character. The exposure variable of interest.
.adjustment_vars

Character vector. The variables to adjust for in the model.
.model_function

A function object. The function to use for the modeling.
.exponentiate

Logical. Default is false. Whether to exponentiate the model results output, usually necessary for e.g. logistic regression models.
...

Options to pass to the model function.

Value

Outputs a tibble with all the models computed and their estimates.

Examples


library(dplyr)
metabolite_network <- simulated_data %>%
  select(matches("metabolite")) %>%
  nc_create_network()
simulated_data %>%
  nc_exposure_estimates(
    .graph = metabolite_network,
    .exposure = "exposure",
    .adjustment_vars = "age",
    .model_function = lm
   )
#> # A tibble: 551 x 11
#>    exposure index_node model_id term  estimate std_error statistic   p_value
